articles.title: Scientists race to make 'living' computers powered by human cells - BBC
articles.description: BBC News goes inside the lab powering computers with 'mini brains' grown from human cells.

articles.title: ‘Smiling Friends’ Team Launches New L.A.-Based Animation Studio - Deadline
articles.description: Smiling Friends creators Michael Cusack and Zach Hadel and producer Aron Fromm have launched Zam Studios, a new LA-based independent animation studio.

articles.title: Google reportedly testing MediaTek modem for Tensor G6 and Pixel 11 - 9to5Google
articles.description: The Tensor G6 for the Pixel 11 is rumored to switch to a MediaTek modem. With the Pixel 10 just over a month old...

articles.title: Sources: Naveen Rao’s new AI hardware startup targets $5B valuation with backing from a16z - TechCrunch
articles.description: Former Databricks AI chief is raising $1 billion to build an Nvidia rival through a novel approach.

articles.title: Xbox’s Hike on Game Pass Shows Cost of Lost ‘Call of Duty’ Sales - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Microsoft Corp.’s Xbox division surprised many video game enthusiasts this week when the company announced a 50% price hike, to $30 a month, for the highest level tier in its Game Pass subscription service.

articles.title: How to Turn Off AI Tools Like Gemini, Apple Intelligence, Copilot, and More - Consumer Reports
articles.description: AI features are crowding into Google search, Gmail, iPhones, Windows laptops, and other products. If you're suffering from AI overload, these settings can help.

articles.title: 5 Things To Know Before Starting Digimon Story: Time Stranger - Kotaku
articles.description: Here are a few tips before you head into the Digital World

articles.title: Do AI-designed proteins create a biosecurity vulnerability? - Ars Technica
articles.description: Ordering DNA for AI-designed toxins doesn’t always raise red flags.

articles.title: Video game blockbuster 'Ghost of Yotei' wears its cinematic influences on its sleeve - WBUR
articles.description: One of the fall’s biggest video games plays like an interactive Samurai movie.

articles.title: One Of Steam's Most-Wishlisted Games Indefinitely Delayed Days Before Launch - Kotaku
articles.description: Kingmakers won't come to Steam in October after all

articles.title: Snapchat is going to charge for storage — here’s how to save your Memories for free - TechCrunch
articles.description: If your Memories exceed the new limit, you will need to either export them or sign up for one of Snapchat's new Memories Storage plans in order to preserve them.

articles.title: Unity discloses a years-old security exploit and urges developers to update their games - The Verge
articles.description: Unity is urging developers to take “immediate action” after it disclosed a major security vulnerability in its development tool.

articles.title: World of Warcraft Getting Rid of Major Feature after 13 Years in Midnight - Game Rant
articles.description: World of Warcraft: Midnight removes a popular feature that players have enjoyed for over 13 years, much to the dismay of players who enjoyed it.

articles.title: Google’s Gemini AI app could soon be getting a big makeover - TechCrunch
articles.description: The company is seemingly experimenting with a new user interface that would shift the app from having a chatbot-style look and feel to one offering a scrollable feed with suggested prompts accompanied by eye-catching photos.

articles.title: Amazon’s Fire TV Stick 4K is getting a new name soon - The Verge
articles.description: The naming confusion caused by the 4K Select will subside…maybe…hopefully.

articles.title: You Can Stay on Windows 10 for Free If You Do This by Oct. 14 - PCMag
articles.description: Microsoft ends support for its older OS this month, but there are three ways to stay on Windows 10, two of which are free.

articles.title: Get 24 Pack Hourglasses by Celebrating Pokémon TCG Pocket in Stores - Pokemon.com
articles.description: Get a code redeemable for 24 in-game pack hourglasses at participating locations.

articles.title: Microsoft is about to launch free Xbox Cloud Gaming with ads - The Verge
articles.description: Microsoft is getting ready to launch an ad-supported version of Xbox Cloud Gaming. The free streaming is being tested internally at Microsoft.

articles.title: Apple iPhone 17 Pro review: Come for the camera, stay for the battery - Ars Technica
articles.description: If your iPhone is your main or only camera, the iPhone 17 Pro is for you.

articles.title: Apple Glasses are coming: Here’s every rumored new feature - 9to5Mac
articles.description: Based on the latest leaks and reporting, here is every new feature to expect with Apple’s next wearable product: Apple Glasses.
